fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12225].
  {panel}

Currently, the instructions we have available on [Migrate to Another Database|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrate+to+Another+Database] are lacking coverage for the scenario where XML backups are too large. Particularly large instances cannot use the XML export/import method due to the sheer size of the backup and limitations with the JVM Heap size on 32-bit Operating Systems. 

The exact problem is people in this situation are required to manually export the data from their existing database and then import it into their new database using their own DB tools (which is an appropriate step) however when it comes to setting up the connection to Confluence this becomes problematic, as the setup wizard detects that there is existing data and you cannot proceed without overwriting it.

This can be bypassed, by manually configuring the *confluence.cfg.xml* with the appropriate dialect settings, DB connection URL and login credentials but not all users will know how to do this (and we don't have documentation on it). 

One particular issue occurred recently when a customer attempted to migrate their existing MySQL Database to Oracle; the problem being this exact scenario - the setup instructions require you to run the setup wizard, which will consequently overwrite all the existing database to configure the new connection. The issue was resolved in the support case with instructions on how to configure the *confluence.cfg.xml* file, and he has since contributed a PDF containing detailed instructions on how to perform this type of migration (Thanks to Sherif Mansour). It would be handy if we could review this and add this to the appropriate section of our documentation linked to [Migrate to Another Database|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrate+to+Another+Database].
fields.summary: Update Migrate to Another Database instructions on CAC

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12221].
  {panel}

Don't know whether this actually will take off, but it's an easy thing to add, and does improve usability.

http://universaleditbutton.org/Universal_Edit_Button
http://www.readwriteweb.com/archives/wiki_universal_edit_button.php

The Universal Edit Button is a green pencil icon wiki.png in the address bar that indicates a web page is editable. It is similar to the orange "broadcast" RSS icon ExampleRSS.png that indicates there is an RSS feed available.
fields.summary: Support for Universal Edit Button

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12219].
  {panel}

We use LDAP to authenticate from user data in Microsoft AD.

Please see support.atlassian.com ticket (CSP-17940)

Request:
Implement paging for LDAP search requests, so that organizations with more than 1000 users can view all of their users in site administration (without adversely modifying ldap server parameters) and LDAP filters of moderate complexity can be supported.  The LDAP paging control OID is 1.2.840.113556.1.4.319.
fields.summary: Implement paging for LDAP search requests

fields.description:
The plugin upload/installation fails silently every time I try to upload our custom theme plugin and forget to uninstall the old version.

This is super annoying. Can't you fix this so that when an upload happens and an older version of the uploaded plugin exists, this older version is automatically uninstalled and the new version is installed?

thanks,
Igor
fields.summary: Plugin upload fails silently if an older version is already installed

fields.description:
Because the calendar in news posts is floated right, it interacts very badly with full-width block elements in the news post itself:

!Float and calendar.jpg!

Also, if you insert a line-break into your blog-post, the clear=all we put on the break will cause the next line to flow past the calendar, leaving a big gap:

!whitespace.jpg!
fields.summary: Floated calendar in default news item theme interacts badly with wiki markup
Include link to current version when browsing page history

fields.description:
A very simple plugin with only a single theme and only a single decorator override of main.vmd renders differently when the theme is selected even though main.vmd is an exact copy of what comes with Confluence.

This is the case with Confluence 2.8 which comes out badly. Confluence 2.8.1 still behaves differently than it should though it's less bad.

I've attached both a zip for this very simple project which can be built with maven and the jar for the plugin itself.

I'm also adding some screen shots of the behavior.
fields.summary: simple theme with a copy of the main.vmd file renders differently

fields.description: Is there any reason why absolute links with titles are rendered with css class nobr? I think that this is a regression that was not present in 2.7 or older version of Confluence. The nobr css class applied to this links breaks wiki pages that use section and column macros along with links. h4. example markup: [title|http://foo.bar/baz] html: title
fields.summary: Absolute links are rendered as nobr

fields.description:
A few customers have reported that when Confluence size has grown quite large (eg. *entities.xml file* is over 200MB), neither daily backup nor manual XML backup produced contain the *exportdescriptor.properties* file. 

Despite this, no error message is logged in the log file.

The backup does not seem to be corrupted, as adding a copy of *exportdescriptor.properties* file of the same version into the zip folder appears to resolve the problem.

This problem can be replicated in house with large XML backup.
fields.summary: Missing exportdescriptor.properties on XML backup

fields.description:
I replicate the problem of blog-posts under the following circumstances.

# Create 1 news on date 18 June
# Create 3 news on date 19 June
# Create 6 news on date 20 June
# Create 2 news on date 21 June

The following is the test results using macro (the number of items will be limited to 5):
{noformat}
{blog-posts:5|time=1d|content=excerpts}
{noformat}
# If I create a page with the above macro on date 20 June Then, Confluence generates a list of news from date 19 June, 20 June and 21 June. 
# If I create a page which contains the above macro on date 21, then Confluence generates news from date 20 June and 21 June. 
# If I create a page on 22, then Confluence generates news from 21 June.

The blog posts macro will display a list of news incorrectly whenever the OS time is wrong.
fields.summary: blog-posts macro displays news incorrectly when OS time set incorrectly

fields.description:
Many of our customers complain about confluence crashes which are due to {{java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space}} 

We should add to the JAVA_OPTS flag  to include -XX:MaxPermSize=128m by default.
fields.summary: Double the default PermGen space for confluence distributions

fields.description:
While debugging an issue in our custom authenticator that creates and updates user accounts during logins, I found something that appears to be a bug in how DefaultHibernateUser objects are being handled (and cached?) in confluence.

It looks like the DefaultHibernateUser objects are being cached with its (groups) collections attached with the hibernate session that performed an operation on the object recently (in a different thread). When another thread with a new hibernate session attempts to update such a user instance the exception below is thrown. *We are not passing the objects between threads via http session or in any other way.* Each thread obtains an instance of the user class via userAccessor.

Steps to reproduce:

You need two threads that get the user instance via an instance of UserAccessor, and call UserAccessor#saveUser(confUser).

# thread 1 opens a hibernate session
# thread 2 opens a hibernate session
# thread 1 fetches a user
# thread 1 saves the user
# thread 2 fetches the same user as thread #1
# thread 2 saves the user
# {color:red} the exception is thrown in thread 2
# thread 1 closes the hibernate session - this is important, it seems that if the session was closed before thread 2 called saveUser, everything would be ok
# thread 2 closes the hibernate session



The exception:
{noformat}
org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateSystemException: Illegal attempt to associate a collection with two open sessions; 
nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.HibernateException: Illegal attempt to associate a collection with two open sessions
Caused by: net.sf.hibernate.HibernateException: Illegal attempt to associate a collection with two open sessions
        at net.sf.hibernate.collection.PersistentCollection.setCurrentSession(PersistentCollection.java:257)
        at net.sf.hibernate.impl.OnUpdateVisitor.processCollection(OnUpdateVisitor.java:38)
        at net.sf.hibernate.impl.AbstractVisitor.processValue(AbstractVisitor.java:69)
        at net.sf.hibernate.impl.AbstractVisitor.processValues(AbstractVisitor.java:36)
        at net.sf.hibernate.impl.AbstractVisitor.process(AbstractVisitor.java:91)
        at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.doUpdateMutable(SessionImpl.java:1466)
        at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.doUpdate(SessionImpl.java:1480)
        at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.saveOrUpdate(SessionImpl.java:1403)
        at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate$12.doInHibernate(HibernateTemplate.java:604)
        at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:370)
        at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.saveOrUpdate(HibernateTemplate.java:601)
        at com.atlassian.user.impl.hibernate.HibernateUserManager.saveUser(HibernateUserManager.java:171)
        at com.atlassian.user.impl.cache.CachingUserManager.saveUser(CachingUserManager.java:143)
        at com.atlassian.user.impl.delegation.DelegatingUserManager.saveUser(DelegatingUserManager.java:144)
        at bucket.user.DefaultUserAccessor.saveUser(DefaultUserAccessor.java:224)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
        at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:296)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:177)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:144)
        at com.atlassian.spring.interceptors.SpringProfilingInterceptor.invoke(SpringProfilingInterceptor.java:20)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:166)
        at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:107)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:166)
        at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)

fields.description:
*Problem description*: When you install a plugin compiled with Java 5 in a Confluence application running with Java 1.4, you get the following error:

org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'isModuleEnabled' in class com.atlassian.confluence.admin.actions.plugins.ManagePluginsAction threw exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid complete key specified: null @ /admin/plugins.vm[109,42]
 at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:286)
caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid complete key specified: null
 at com.atlassian.plugin.ModuleCompleteKey.(ModuleCompleteKey.java:17)

You cannot view the plugin in the plugin manager to uninstall it. See the workaround below.

*Desired behaviour*: Confluence should disable the plugin and show a meaningful error to the user.

*Cause*: This occurs when uploading a plugin into Confluence running an older version of Java than the plugin was compiled with.

*Workaround*: Run Confluence with the same version of Java as the plugin or, if you are the plugin author, recompile the plugin to Java 1.4 to support all Confluence instances. The first option is the way to uninstall a plugin with this problem in affected versions of Confluence.

*Technical notes*:

The causal exception is shown further up in the logs:

2008-06-23 10:40:31,005 ERROR [http-8080-Processor3] [atlassian.plugin.parsers.XmlDescriptorParser] createModuleDescriptor There was a problem loading the descriptor for module 'velocity-context-item' in plugin 'Metova Theme'.
Class version is incompatible with current JVM: com.metova.confluence.ThemeHelper
- url: /admin/uploadplugin.action | userName: admin | action: uploadplugin
com.atlassian.plugin.PluginParseException: Class version is incompatible with current JVM: com.metova.confluence.ThemeHelper
at com.atlassian.plugin.descriptors.AbstractModuleDescriptor.init(AbstractModuleDescriptor.java:75)
at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.VelocityContextItemModuleDescriptor.init(VelocityContextItemModuleDescriptor.java:24)
at com.atlassian.plugin.parsers.XmlDescriptorParser.createModuleDescriptor(XmlDescriptorParser.java:147)
at com.atlassian.plugin.parsers.XmlDescriptorParser.configurePlugin(XmlDescriptorParser.java:85)
at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ClassLoadingPluginLoader.deployPluginFromUnit(ClassLoadingPluginLoader.java:99)
at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ClassLoadingPluginLoader.addFoundPlugins(ClassLoadingPluginLoader.java:151)
at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.DatabaseClassLoadingPluginLoader.addFoundPlugins(DatabaseClassLoadingPluginLoader.java:116)

This problem was also reported on the forum here:

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=25904&tstart=-1
fields.summary: Error when installing plugin: IllegalArgumentException: Invalid complete key specified: null @ /admin/plugins.vm

fields.description:
{quote}
If you have a parent page and a child page and the parent page is restricted,
then the child page will (correctly) be likewise restricted. But if you MOVE
the child page somewhere else, it stays restricted even though its new parent
has no restrictions.
I was able to correct the situation by adding and then removing the same
restriction from the new parent page, which had the effect of clearing out
the child restrictions as well.

We have an internal company newsletter, which is created inside Confluence. First as a child of an under construction page (which has viewing restrictions) after which the newsletter is moved to become a child of the recently appeared page.

Moving the page does not change the permissions:

*the old viewing restrictions still apply
*when going to Info of the page you still see the old viewing restrictions and the name of the previous parent page
*when editing the restrictions of the page itself, the inherited restrictions are not mentioned, so there they seem to be displayed correctly. 
{quote}
fields.summary: Moving a page in page tree does not update page restrictions

fields.description:

fields.description:
The user table of the atlassian user repo doesn't have unique index on the {{name}} column. This allows duplicates to be created under certain circumstances. Since many other tables in the confluence db refer to the user via name instead of the id, this can cause data integrity and potentially also security issues.

{code:type=SQL}
 CREATE TABLE `users` (
  `id` bigint(20) NOT NULL default '0',
  `name` varchar(255) NOT NULL default '',
  `password` varchar(255) default NULL,
  `email` varchar(255) default NULL,
  `created` datetime default NULL,
  `fullname` varchar(255) default NULL,
  PRIMARY KEY  (`id`)
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 
{code}
fields.summary: Duplicate user accounts allowed in database because no unique constraint configured on USER table

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12168]. {panel} It would be useful to have a link next to the search button, to the page [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Search+Syntax] so that users are aware of the different search syntax. Otherwise users will not why their search for web, does not make pages which has words such as websphere, webinar, etc. (To search for these you need to search for "web*"). In the meantime, you can add the link via editing the file {{confluence/template/includes/macros.vm}}. Search for "quickSearch" and add a href link to the documentation. E.g. It should look like this {noformat} #macro (quickSearch)
#* search only global spaces by default *# ?
#end {noformat} If you wish to add a link under the go button in the search page, edit your {{confluence/search/searchpanel.vm}} file and add a href link next to the new search link. E.g. {noformat} #tag( Submit "value='go.button'" "align='left'" "theme='notable'")

fields.description:
When the named cache which backs a {{TangosolClusteredFifoBuffer}} loses entries (due to expiry or overflow), the implementation does not attempt any recovery but will get stuck on null entries at the current pointer location.

Instead, the implementation should look at the present key set of the underlying cache and adjust the buffer pointers to suit.

fields.description: A macro developer should be able to specify whether the Rich Text editor should display the body as raw wiki markup or as processed wiki markup. Currently, if you want to expand the functionality of your tables by using the {table-plus} macro, you lose the ability to edit the content as a table in the Rich Text editor, because the content of the macro is shown as raw wiki markup. Additionally, if you attempt to edit the content of a table in the {table-plus} macro from within the Rich Text editor, the editor may remove spaces between the pipe characters in the table, both changing empty cells into header cells and reducing the number of cells in the row.

fields.description:
If you happen to have the same username exists in both local Confluence and LDAP and the LDAP username is in uppercase/initcap, accessing the people directory shows duplicate users. Please see the attached screen shot:

Here are the steps to reproduce the problem:

# Create a local user named "alex fong" for example
# Perform the LDAP integration (presume that there is an user named "Alex Fong" with initcap in LDAP)
# Grant permission to the LDAP user
# Login with "Alex Fong" credential
# Clicking the {{Preferences}} link
# Accessing the {{People directory}}

You should be able to see the duplicate entries. This problem is also happening if the username with uppercase/initcap are from LDAP and not exists in local Confluence.
fields.summary: LDAP username with UPPERCASE/Initcap shows duplicate entries in the people directory

fields.description:
If a user sets up some invalid DN for base group search e.g. 

{code:xml}
        <ldap key="ldapRepository" name="LDAP Repository@hecate.atlassian.com" cache="true">
			<host>192.168.3.146</host>
			<port>389</port>
			<securityPrincipal>cn=manager,dc=atlassian,dc=test</securityPrincipal>
			<securityCredential>secret</securityCredential>
			<securityProtocol>plain</securityProtocol>
			<securityAuthentication>simple</securityAuthentication>
			<baseContext>dc=atlassian,dc=test</baseContext>

			<baseUserNamespace>ou=people,dc=atlassian,dc=test</baseUserNamespace>
			<baseGroupNamespace>ou=blah,ou=groups,dc=atlassian,dc=test</baseGroupNamespace>
			<usernameAttribute>cn</usernameAttribute>
			<userSearchFilter>(objectClass=inetorgperson)</userSearchFilter>
			<firstnameAttribute>givenname</firstnameAttribute>
			<surnameAttribute>sn</surnameAttribute>
			<emailAttribute>mail</emailAttribute>
			<groupnameAttribute>cn</groupnameAttribute>
			<groupSearchFilter>(objectClass=dummyValue)</groupSearchFilter>
			<membershipAttribute>member</membershipAttribute>
			<userSearchAllDepths>false</userSearchAllDepths>
			<groupSearchAllDepths>false</groupSearchAllDepths>
		</ldap>
{code}

In the above we are not interested in LDAP groups thus they have set the objectClass to equal dummyValue . However the baseGroupNameSpace is incorrect. It refers to a non existing DN. (correct DN is 
"ou=groups,dc=atlassian,dc=test" with no blah). 

However if you go to manage groups, it will return a null pointer exception as UserAcessor.getGroups returns a null due to the bad DN. 
It also does not proceed to continue checking other repositories. That is, because this throws an error, the groups table is not checked for internal confluence groups, hence permissions fail to work. 

This error could be better handled.
fields.summary: Invalid LDAP group configuration means no groups are retrieved, even from local repository

fields.description:
Because of BONNIE-10, large content bodies will not be stored.
When the user performs a search that should pick up that result, the previous results expert seems to be shown instead of an empty excerpt.
Content of test-big-attachment.txt is: - and can be found in bonnie/src/etc/test/test-big-attachment.txtThis is a text file for testing attachments - foobar.
So obviously the excerpt being shown is incorrect.
fields.summary: Search results with empty content body inherits exerpt from previous search result

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12140].
  {panel}

> > Hi,
> >
> > I'm currently looking for a wiki-based solution that would allow my 
> > company to create and administrate a knowledge base for it's 
> > engineers. One of the main criterias is that this solution has to 
> > permit search into Mathcad sheets (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mathcad 
> > ), which are used to compute scientific calculations.
> >
> > I understand that Confluence can certainly not read those files, but 
> > is it possible that its search engine could find key words into 
> > these sheets if they were present, melted with code ?
> >
> > Regards,
> > Christophe Sutter
fields.summary: Index the content of .xmcd (Mathcad Sheets) Attachements

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to group templates together.
e.g. for example i have a template for _cats_ , _dogs_ and _fishes_ i could great a group named _pets_ and place all templates under this goup.

A template could then be accessed through _pets:cats_ or sth. like that.


So  if you have many templates it would be more clearly.

fields.description:
The tree will display the origin space, but the dropdown will show the targeted space.

This means that if you attempt to move a page from one space to another which results in a clash, you have to set the space to another space and then set it back. This is inconvenient but tolerable.
fields.summary: Moving a page to another space which contains a page with the same title does not correctly reset the location drop down

fields.description:
Hi
I had a issue raised by a user that a large amount (but not all) of the start and finish times in their calendar had reset to 1 hour earlier.
I checked his time settings and that of the server and all appeared normal.
After much head scratching i gave up and he agreed to change them all back to the original time.
Sure enough the next day the times had reset to their original setting which beacuse the user had brought them forward meant they were now 1 hour ahead of what they should have been.
Needless to say he is not a happy camper! :)
Have you heard of this happening before and do you know a possible cause?


Cheers

Steve Picton
Red Wahoo
fields.summary: Calendar times changed themselves by 1 hour

fields.description:
The following pages (maybe others?) need to be updated:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+multiple+LDAP+repositories
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+atlassian-user.xml

Maybe with something like I've put in atlassian-user.xml:

{noformat}<!--
     If you are using a key other than "ldapRepository" and "hibernateRepository", you will
     need to extract the following files from confluence.jar and change the cache names:

     - confluence/WEB-INF/classes/confluence-coherence-cache-config.xml
     - confluence/WEB-INF/classes/confluence-coherence-cache-config-clustered.xml

     See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Performance+Tuning#PerformanceTuning-CacheTuning
-->
{noformat}

and also in the cache confluence-coherence-cache-config.xml file itself:

{noformat}
<!-- NOTE:
     If you are changing the names of the LDAP or Hibernate user/group repositories, you need to make the
     necessary changes to atlassian-user.xml

     See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+atlassian-user.xml
-->{noformat}

See CONF-11857 for the original issue
fields.summary: Documentation about ldap and hibernate cache keys/repository names should be ammended

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12124].
  {panel}

There are a variety of rendering issues when using multiple dynamic tasklists in a table. The issues vary depending on whether its dynamic tasklist or dynamic tasklist 2.

To replicate, make a table like this:
{noformat}
|| *A* || *B* || *C* || *D* || *E* || *F* ||
| A | B | C | D | E | {dynamictasklist:Hari1} |
| A | B | C | D | E | {dynamictasklist:Hari2} |
| A | B | C | D | E | {dynamictasklist:Hari3} |
{noformat}

Add tasks of different names, then refresh the page.

1: Titles of tasklists are only the first name.
2: Tasks are munged so they all appear on all tasklists
3: For dynamic tasklist 2, it's rendered as if it's a nested table, which doesn't work.

This may be an unsupported configuration - in which case we should document that dynamic tasklists inside tables is not supported.
fields.summary: dynamic tasklist does not render correctly in table

fields.description:
Confluence 2.8 includes version 1.6 of Batik, but the most recent release of the Batik SVG Toolkit is 1.7.

http://xmlgraphics.apache.org/batik/download.cgi

Batik 1.7 introduces some important features that will enable the Gliffy Diagram for Confluence to render diagram images in an improved manner.

Please upgrade to Batik 1.7 as soon as possible.

thanks!
fields.summary: Upgrade version of Batik included with Confluence to version 1.7
Include link to troubleshooting db in Setup wizard

fields.description:
2.9 will include search by author. Documentation changes will be needed for the search macro, the search screen and the search RPC service.

The only one implemented so far is the RPC search so the documentation [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Remote+API+Specification] will need modified.

The table titled "Parameters for Limiting Search Results" needs a new entry something like -
| contributor | The original creator or any editor of Confluence content. | any Confluence user's username | no filter by contributor |
fields.summary: Update RPC search documentation to include contributor field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-12107].
  {panel}

XML backups fail at a certain size, regularly. We recommend the alternative backup strategy:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Alternative+Backup+Strategy+for+Large+Confluence+Sites

This is a more effective way to do backups anyways.  The xml backup should be a migrate-db-only solution. Other than that, DBAs should be expected to made db dump backups.

This should change in both the documentation and in the product. I am going to change the db setup guides to include this as a standard procedure when setting up an external db. Here's what would be nice for product-level changes:

1) An email notiification should be sent when an xml backup fails.
2) A banner should be displayed in <baseurl>/admin after a failed backup.
3) A note should be added to the hsqldb note about db backups after migration
